metadata.name: Snowflakes of Eternity #25
metadata.description:
These generative digital snowflakes will never melt.
Find your own unique eternal snowflake.

Features:
- 16 different palettes
- 4 snowflake styles
- 2 kinds of orientation
- 2 kinds of surrounding
- Single snowflake or Couple of snowflakes

There are 103 color sets, 3 frame, 4 fragment and 2 dyeing types.

They all have their own personality... Be sure to name and take care of them.

tw: williamapan

metadata.name: pulau gen #50
metadata.description:
We have spent months looking for the anatomy of space. I think each of us have really been searching for it for decades. But  only recently have we decided to conjugate our efforts. 

The arrangement of the features of a territory has been seen by many before us as something to be probed. The topographic endeavours of the explorers who have sliced the earth tried to make it finite. But even they know that they missed most of what was to be found. 

Daratan has started their explorations with pen and paper. Their pulaus are three-dimensional projections of units extracted from a planet that doesn’t exist. And yet these representations are immediately naturalised, for they evoke geographic norms which describe the world to those who wouldn’t see it for what it is. 

Anaglyphic took the opposite perspective, and set up abstraction generators that would enable others to create areas to be explored. The anaverse is a system which generates topographies according to simple rules which, called recursively, allow for unbounded diversity. Rather than observing space and trying to deduce what it is, they allow humans to build space and, in the process, prompt them to reflect on what they think it should be.

The temporary intersection of these individual journeys yielded pulau gen. In an attempt to demineralise both our media, we decided to populate the pulaus with guardian creatures. The whales, octopi and birds are as many reminders that a topographic representation is usually missing the one thing that matters the most about it: the life it can host.

metadata.name: 0b11111100110 #64
metadata.description: A piece to close off the year 2021, and head into 2022.

metadata.name: reKäp #28
metadata.description:
Chaotic bursts of vertexes, 2022 edition.
Reminiscent of early 2000s flyer design && Macromedia Freehand abuse
hbd (fx)hash! 

Artwork renders in 4:5 aspect by default, 
press space to render artwork in window size.
Press 2/3 to render in double/triple resolution
Press s to save canvas


100% of primary to Tezos4Iran

metadata.name: Rite of Passage #188
metadata.description:
In life, we all take different paths, different rites of passage, and while the end is all that's ever true, we will still all view it and experience it in very different ways, like that masterpiece hanging on the wall at the end of our gallery visit. 
  

There are always things that we will never have the power to change, but at the same time, we determine the route, we influence the journey, we can choose the person we want to be. We'll look back on memories, we'll have regrets, and we'll think about what could have been - but unlike this artwork, in the end we won't be able to change the final output by simply pressing a number - so live well and be happy my friends. 

---------------------

Generative artwork by Sykcolo / @sykcoloart

Primary sale proceeds:
50% to Processing Foundation
50% to Savepakistan

Royalties:
50% to the original minter
50% to artist (me)

Press '2' to '4' to see what could have been + increase pixel density. 
Press 's' to save

Details:

150 hand-picked colour pallets (thanks to @SteveMakerspace for colour selection method)
2 Frame types
4 Art types
2 Times of day (light or dark background)

License: MIT

Happy Birthday fxhash

metadata.name: a pale reflection #331
metadata.description:
a canvas is prepared; grids and vignette applied.

marks are added (or not)

a drawing method is chosen

the drawing method is iterated, resulting in a heavily stippled image

the image is sent to a shader

various maths occur inside the shader

the resulting shaded image is then given a border

and thus to the screen

a pale reflection - original music here: https://rtsixty.bandcamp.com/track/pale-reflection 
listen while waiting to be signed.

99.9% of royalties to original minter.

metadata.name: Bonsai Bonanza #486
metadata.description:
In previous works, I was attracted by the idea of ​​the domestication of plants.
According to Wikipedia, the purposes of bonsai are primarily contemplation for the viewer, and the pleasant exercise of effort and ingenuity for the grower. By contrast with other plant cultivation practices, bonsai is not intended for production of food or for medicine. Instead, bonsai practice focuses on long-term cultivation and shaping of one or more small trees growing in a container.
I pressume that the main intention is aesthetic. The beauty. Because we love beautiful things.
It is very interesting how we modify certain creatures for our sake of satisfaction.

May this collection brings you good fortune.

metadata.name: Arabian Rugs #12
metadata.description:
Inspired  by "Ardabil Carpets"( https://www.iransafar.co/wp-content/uploads/2021/images/safavids/Ardabil-Carpet.jpg ) dating back to 1539 AD.

Ranked among the most exquisite and famous rugs in the world in terms of design and texture.

Created by tengat using p5js.
License: CC BY-NC 4.0 

Wednesday, 23 November, 2022
Twitter: @tengatart

metadata.name: Panta Rei #31
metadata.description:
Everything changes, nothing stays the same, there is no absolute truth, the only reality is perennial movement.

Press 's' in live mode for high resolution png export.

Made with p5js, September, 2022.

Tagovi:

metadata.name: Illuminations #344
metadata.description:
Created for the FxHash Turns One week - Thank you FxHash for all the opportunities you have given generative artists and collectors, and thank you to everyone who makes, and collects, the great art here. Here are a few celebratory generative effects which come from my 2022 experiments on random walks through color and space.

There are 5 different burst patterns (Whirligig, Sky Ripple, Confetti, Classic, Sparkler) and the Cocktail type brings them all together (somewhat chaotically)

To continue with the display after it stops press c

To switch to tranquil mode press t - You will want to try this out when you have a minute

To switch back to live mode press v

To stop the display process press x

To save a 2800x2800 jpg press s

Made with p5.js - all proceeds and royalties assigned to the Processing Foundation (who also deserve a big thank you)

This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

metadata.name: Ceremony #99
metadata.description:
This series celebrates fxhash turning one. #fxhashturnsone

I’m so grateful for this place and have ho idea how to adequately articulate how much this platform has changed my life, but it has. A million thanks to the team. You are so appreciated as are the artists and collectors that have made this such a beautiful community. 🥂

Definitely check out “Forever” mode by tapping “F” or mouse click/tap — it will animate (you guessed it) forever and will change its layout every 365 frames, in honor of this wonderful year, and every year after. Some forever modes will “never forget” and others will fade as they progress. No idea if that’s a metaphor but it is a trait, that much I know.

All primary sales are donated to Code/Art, which is a charity that uses “…Art to Inspire Girls in Computer Science.” Read about Code/Art here: https://www.code-art.com/

Ceremony uses public domain art (which is the original, more implicit version CC0) made exclusively by women.

See fxtext article linked from the project page for a gallery of the source material and other notes.

Ceremony is also CC0, so feel free use anything here in other projects.

You can read more about CC0 here:
https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/

F : “Forever” mode (tap after initial render completes)
P : Pause/Play
(mouse click/tap also works to start “Forever” mode or Pause/Play)

A : Add Grain (only works when paused in “Forever” mode.)
G : Toggle Grain (resets the whole piece)
M : Toggle Matte (resets the whole piece)

S : Save Image
1 -> 6 : Set pixel density (resets the whole piece)
(Default pixel density is 1 @ 2000x2000)

If you want to start in "Forever" mode, you can append "&forever=true" to the url in the live view.
You can also add pixel density to the url by appending “&density=2” (or 3, 4, etc) to have it render at higher resolutions by default.

metadata.name: Trasiedoc #509
metadata.description:
Behind every generative art project is a code. This code is sometimes a masterpiece but most viewers do not see it.

With the Trasiedoc project I wanted to highlight the hidden face of generative art, the code, by literally integrating the code of my biggest project to date (Dencity) in each output of the Trasiedoc project.

Margins can be hidden by pressing "x" in live mode (and optionally press "p" to see if anything happens).

Made with ❤️, code, code and p5js.

metadata.name: fx(mash) #74
metadata.description:
fx(mash) is my humble contribution to celebrating #fxhashturnsone

This series is based on a simple algorithm - lines of a random length are drawn on a square grid until the grid is full.

I have added a variety of features based on some of my favorite fxhash projects and a few special guests.

This collection is intentionally diverse and disorderly, that's a nice way of saying I only had a short period of time following the release of Acequia. As a result, some of the outputs might be weird, messy, or even bordering on broken (if you get one of the latter please let me know and I'll reimburse you).

Despite being a bit rough around the edges, I hope fx(mash) reflects some measure of my love for the fxhash community. If you're feeling kind, then perhaps it even harks back to the experimental early days :)

The last year has been an incredible journey, thank you for letting me be a part of our story so far.

Controls (in live view):

- Press [s] to save the current image
- Press [g] to toggle grain
- Press [h] for a high-res output

Beta Controls (in live view, definitely not fully tested):

- Press [p] to start/pause animation
- Press [i] to slow down animation
- Press [o] to speed up animation

All primary sales go to Savepakistan.


Acknowledgements:

fx(mash) uses Gorilla Sun's grain implementation, a big thanks to him and meezwhite for a great article that is well worth supporting https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Thank you to the artists who created the following collections. Some were the source for palettes, others directly inspired traits, and some I thought would be fun to include as specific trait values.

metadata.name: Generative Irezumi  #88
metadata.description:
Irezumi (入れ墨) is the Japanese word for tattoo, and is used in English to refer to a distinctive style of Japanese tattooing.
It is also used as a blanket term to describe a number of tattoo styles originating in Japan.

3d interactive scene :
- Left Click to turn around 
- Right/Middle click + Drag to zoom 

"P" to make a portrait screenshot and save a .png file
"O" to make a landscape screenshot and save a .png file

metadata.name: NOMADS #16
metadata.description:
NOMADS tells a story through each of its editions: the migration of a population, following simple rules, and whose movements reveal complex shapes and textures, both visual and auditory.
Movement, order, chaos, borders, convergence, wandering, rotation... it's all part of NOMADS

Enjoy the journey as much as the destination


KEYBOARD SHORCUTS:
[S]: Redraw the art and save a 4K PNG
[L]: Toggle between "Infinite Loop" and "Single Render" modes
[M]: Toggle mute

MOUSE / TOUCHSCREEN:
[Click / Tap]: Toggle mute
[Double Click / Double Tap]: Save the current render

URL PARAMETERS:
?start : bypass the intro timer and start the rendering
?loop : select the "Infinite Loop" mode by default
?resolution=1920x1080 : render in a custom resolution using the format WIDTHxHEIGHT. Different aspect ratios will produce different results.
?frame=0.1 : control the frame size around the canvas (value between 0 and 1)
?save : automatically save the image when the rendering is done


Artist: Estienne
Oct. 2022
NFT 2.0 License

Best viewed on Chrome or Chromium based browser
Tested on Chrome v 106.0.5249.119

Libraries used:
p5.js
Tone.js
